channel.title: Buzzing on Quora
channel.description: 用中文浏览Quora上的热门回答

item.title: How did Mariupol get its name? Greek linguists and historians explain the connection to Catherine the Great: https://t.co/1cdpylqA8Y
What do lawyers think about #RoeVWade? A very illuminating discussion (and don't skip the comments!) https://t.co/bc4L1UNxfb

True professionals don't just answer the question that was asked, they answer what the asker meant. Optical engineer Bill Otto demonstrates in his answer to "How far has the light from our Sun made it?" https://t.co/cqDcsTClNW

With organizations starting to reopen offices, what are the best practices to ensure consistency, avoid confusion, and keep employees happy? Chief HR Legal Expert, Kara Govro, shares advice. https://t.co/ZBQg0k9MkA https://t.co/TiZQBYxEgp

What are some gap year programs to consider before college? Founder and CEO of @moon_prep, personalized application guidance, Kristen Moon, shares her best advice. https://t.co/K8kiTVVp06 https://t.co/kOX5csjcfQ
How can managers build trust with their employees? Answer by Global President at @deputyapp. https://t.co/veXnQbjL0i https://t.co/KOGhFEAgTv
Will Amber Heard survive her defamation trial? President and Chief Executive Officer at @WestCoastTrial, @NeamaRahmani, shares his insights. https://t.co/PytxcwsJEh https://t.co/o06gnVoo0k
Have you ever tried Surströmming? What foods or culinary habits are unusual in your part of the world? https://t.co/C7C5lc84EQ https://t.co/vFcYtMwAvU
What color were the dinosaurs? https://t.co/Fxdu6pHsnO A simple question with a surprisingly complex answer! https://t.co/K0tnKfB2Cd
What's your next move, now that Twitter has been bought by Elon Musk?
What are the limitations of the duties of directors? Answer by filmmaker and Northwestern film professor, Clayton Brown. https://t.co/R1MnBK2ckk https://t.co/IpoAMd1eCR
How do I turn a personal passion into a social outlet and have longevity? Answer by @lawrencekosick, president and co-founder of @GetSetUp_org. https://t.co/5nB2nnRRmn https://t.co/M3afJXekLa
Why was Turkey the one country Nazi Germany would not invade? An interesting perspective and well-told story! https://t.co/Cgkr85M0FX https://t.co/DiqTadso7w
Where does the speed of light come from? Science writer Brandon Ross offers an intuitive explanation that will leave you with more questions: https://t.co/7HwQ9kKSxy
Why is intersectionality important to social justice? @PauliMurrayCntr, breaks it down. https://t.co/nEthL1Al9Z https://t.co/KCEhNNbNCE

How is personal injury law different from other types of law? President and Chief Executive Officer at @WestCoastTrial @NeamaRahmani explains the one main difference. Read about it here: https://t.co/fblq7ydRVo https://t.co/rNDLJKpdhz

What is the easiest way for businesses to reduce their carbon footprint? Hunter Ray Barker (@stuntmanhunter), Co-Founder at @BullfrogAgency, gives three solid strategies. https://t.co/21IZEwEMFH https://t.co/CpI4JMjVLu

What advice would you give to an aspiring lawyer? President and Chief Executive Officer at @WestCoastTrial, @NeamaRahmani, says you need to enjoy two things. Read about them here: https://t.co/GQb3c907JM https://t.co/07BaAh3CyQ
It's the weekend! What is everyone doing? We're reading this enlightening answer about how whiskey ages: https://t.co/thVtib8O5k https://t.co/YpFMLAwGTy
Wondering what Elon Musk's plans are regarding Twitter? Some bright people on Quora read the tea leaves correctly about the takeover. What will their next prediction be? https://t.co/LJDqXSktaN
How smart were the peasants in the middle ages? According to historian Frank Melling, they might be smarter than you think! https://t.co/4WnzBgTqDE https://t.co/ckop1E7g3X

The cleverness of the human species has resulted in such wonderful diversity of architecture. Via the Wonders of the Past Space, we learned about HÓRREOS, a traditional structure on the Iberian peninsula of Spain and Portugal. Can you guess what it's for? https://t.co/dLc4CQsP9n https://t.co/8rZKiVQMhh

Viktor Medvedchuk was recently detained in Ukraine. Who is he and why is this important? To answer the question, we can look at what Ukrainians said about him on Quora prior to the invasion: https://t.co/OSk6ojaHmL
Which kill more birds, wind turbines or office buildings? Quora contributor Michael Barnard does the math: https://t.co/Hs38BXzBdL
Ramadan questions? Quora has you covered: https://t.co/3Ok0DekqPv

What are some causes of demotivation on employees? @stuntmanhunter Co-Founder at @BullfrogAgency, offers advice on identifying and improving employee motivation in your company. https://t.co/cEDzFY9dEW https://t.co/yLZUZMmCXI

What is the best strategy to be used to stay healthy and strong and live to 100? @lawrencekosick President and Co-Founder at @GetSetUp_org, shares his best advice. https://t.co/1cCjS6gHQ9 https://t.co/GV0PV2CMZG

What are your top 5 tips for becoming really vulnerable and honest with yourself? Entrepreneur and former @BacheloretteABC contestant, @Jason_Tartick, answers here: https://t.co/PuSwIvAGh7 https://t.co/AHx3Ewrsxq
What does the deepest cave on Earth look like? Silvia Serra, ancient history enthusiast, shows us: https://t.co/U0nKvMLcx6 https://t.co/Nbmkl1MJO2
Why do so many churches have domes on the top, and how do they work architecturally? Art Historian Bob deWitt explains: https://t.co/nPmUYWttID

The ancient Greeks believed the river Acheron flowed into the underworld. Was there really such a river? 2nd-generation Greek linguist Nick Nicholas shares the history: https://t.co/l7tbMm1SBw https://t.co/iVmz2bbKc0
Could Russia be expelled from the UN Security Council? Read the opinions of legal experts and people from around the world: https://t.co/FsNdYopkRO https://t.co/dVzRAAfYzA
What's the deal with those arm movements that composers make? Let musician and composer Curtis Lindsay explain: https://t.co/EO1qVPvtLF
How do you answer when greeted with Ramadan Mubarak? Muslims on Quora have you covered: https://t.co/ya9ifrHW36
How do people make connections at work? @stuntmanhunter Co-Founder at @BullfrogAgency, shares three easy tips. https://t.co/EuItcxO9H5 https://t.co/30FRVXFotb
What helps with getting older? @lawrencekosick, President and Co-Founder at @GetSetUp_org, shares 7 tips! https://t.co/yZgkFii177 https://t.co/zGqeBe1QlA

Considering your personal strengths and how it can lead to career growth opportunities? Business mentor and corporate trainer, @CWaltersPhD, offers six questions you should ask yourself when determining your path. https://t.co/mp5dw6kXLP https://t.co/68Ep2vFJtm
How should I prepare for the MCAT? Kristen Moon, Founder and CEO of @moon_prep, shares 7 essential tips for preparation. https://t.co/9BFJ2vPsT3 https://t.co/IcosuU1Cwc
How did Jules Verne accurately predict the future in an unpublished manuscript? Niklas Göke has the details: https://t.co/X8xQNueZ03 https://t.co/jxxchBltrB

Fascinating to read about the role of flow or "being in the zone" from all these surgeons! How do surgeons hold out on surgeries more than 6 hours long? Do they rest during the operation? https://t.co/QFfGbj09gQ
How are tractors capable of pulling such heavy loads with their relatively small engines? It's torque, not horsepower! https://t.co/aiFQdzM5nB https://t.co/xZboyLGNCM
What should everyone know about snow and ice management? Weather experts, @WeatherWorks, details how snow and ice management are big business! https://t.co/fMNriXJwhz https://t.co/LnBE7Fj7Ps

Why does filmmaking still use a camera with a large pixel size while many phones have good cameras? Northwestern film professor, Clayton Brown, explains in non-technical terms why phones aren't great for films. https://t.co/ocoWs8rnGe https://t.co/ECmtf18kRx
Entrepreneur and Quora personality Balaji Viswanathan shares a perspective on challenges faced only by Indians: https://t.co/nlAxYBePfq Is he on the mark? https://t.co/1AxOMxw5oD
How have the Ukrainians been using captured Russia war assets? https://t.co/Vg1W2136ck Jason pulls from various sources, including @oryxspioenkop, to paint the picture.
Kyiv/Kiev, Lviv/Lvov - what's the deal with other languages spelling city names differently from the residents? Linguist Nick Nicholas explains: https://t.co/6DQwk7lJxY
How many people would it take to repopulate the Earth after an extinction event? https://t.co/2FvFbQjQva Always the facts you need to know at Quora! 😉

Who was Pauli Murray? The Pauli Murray Center for History and Social Justice (@PauliMurrayCntr), has dedicated its mission to answering this question, preserving their legacy, and teaching others about how history can shape our future. https://t.co/JYsfnVwGIJ https://t.co/3HEWxO1gqY
Why is forgiving student loans so important for our citizens and the economy? California Congressman, @ericswalwell, explains. https://t.co/4GLEDQ60l7 https://t.co/V8l4GRC9Ha
What can both employers and employees do to contribute to a work/life balance? Answer by @CWaltersPhD, business & branding mentor. https://t.co/56XjkoJkae https://t.co/iYsxd3aGds
